thread.title: Luis Suarez claims referee 'wanted to send him off' as first Barcelona red rules him out of Copa del Rey final
thread.title_full: Luis Suarez claims referee 'wanted to send him off' as first Barcelona red rules him out of Copa del Rey final

author: Rory Brigstock-Barron
title: Luis Suarez claims referee 'wanted to send him off' as first Barcelona red rules him out of Copa del Rey final
text:
Sport Luis Suarez claims referee 'wanted to send him off' as first Barcelona red rules him out of Copa del Rey final The former Liverpool striker was dismissed for a second yellow after his arm hit Atletico Madrid's Koke in the face Share Luis Suarez has said the referee wanted to send him off after being dismissed against Atletico Madrid (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Luis Suarez claimed referee Jesus Gil "wanted" to send him off after he was dismissed in Barcelona 's Copa del Rey semi-final second leg against Atletico Madrid. 
The former Liverpool striker scored the opener in the 1-1 draw which saw Barca through to the final 3-2 on aggregate - but became the third player to be sent off for a second yellow as his side were reduced to nine men in the 90th minute. 
The Uruguayan went into the book just three minutes previously for a foul on Juanfran and then was dismissed by referee Gil for catching Koke in the face with a flailing arm. Suarez is shown a red card by referee Jesus Gil in the 90th minute (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) The Uruguayan protests after the second booking for his arm hitting Koke in the face (Photo: AFP) Gil directs Suarez off the pitch (Photo: AFP) The Barcelona goalscorer leaves the field (Photo: AFP) The former Liverpool ace said he laughed as he left the pitch because it wasn't a foul (Photo: AFP) 
The decision certainly looked as the Spaniard made a meal of it, and Suarez was clearly unhappy with the referee after the game. 
"I was laughing at the yellow card, it was what he wanted (the referee), we will see if the club can appeal," he said. 
"It wasn't even a foul." 
Luis Enrique will also be without Sergi Roberto who was sent off for a second yellow in the 57th minute, before Yannick Carrasco levelled the side by picking up his second booking for a foul on Arda Turan with just over 20 minutes to play. Suarez scored last in the first half as Barca sealed their place in the final, which he will now miss (Photo: AFP) 
The dismissals were just one crazy element of a game which also saw an Antoine Griezmann goal wrongly disallowed for offside and substitute Kevin Gameiro miss a penalty. 
In the end Barca, who won the first leg 2-1 in Madrid, went through to their fourth successive Copa del Rey final - where they will play either Alaves or Celta Vigo. 
Enrique says Barca should appeal Suarez's second yellow but he is not hopeful of success. "Look at what's happened in the past." poll loading Did Luis Suarez deserve to be sent off? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
